# FloatingPointRoundingRule.down

**Case**

Round to the closest allowed value that is less than or equal to the source.

## Declaration

```swift
case down
```

## Discussion

The following example shows the results of rounding numbers using this rule:

```swift
(5.2).rounded(.down)
// 5.0
(5.5).rounded(.down)
// 5.0
(-5.2).rounded(.down)
// -6.0
(-5.5).rounded(.down)
// -6.0
```

This rule is equivalent to the C `floor` function and implements the `roundToIntegralTowardNegative` operation defined by the [http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/servlet/opac?punumber=4610933].
title: FloatingPointRoundingRule.down
